docs.snippet: LEAD: A NORTH AMERICAN trading bloc of 250 million people may soon face off against a Western European trading bloc of 320 million people. In Tokyo, Sydney and other Far East centers, Pacific economic cooperation is being discussed more intensively...
docs.lead_paragraph: LEAD: A NORTH AMERICAN trading bloc of 250 million people may soon face off against a Western European trading bloc of 320 million people. In Tokyo, Sydney and other Far East centers, Pacific economic cooperation is being discussed more intensively than at any time in the postwar period.

headline.main: BLOC BY BLOC, THE WORLD IS RAISING TRADE BARRIERS AGAIN

docs.snippet: LEAD: The European Community proposed Friday that major farm-producing nations freeze their agricultural support programs, which have distorted world markets and created hostility between trading partners.
docs.lead_paragraph: LEAD: The European Community proposed Friday that major farm-producing nations freeze their agricultural support programs, which have distorted world markets and created hostility between trading partners.

docs.snippet: LEAD: In a concession to President Reagan, House Democrats agreed today to take up a version of landmark trade legislation without a contested provision that would require companies to give 60 days' notice of factory closings and major layoffs.

headline.main: House to Omit Plant Notice In Trade Bill

byline.original: By SUSAN CHIRA, Special to the New York Times

docs.snippet: LEAD: The annual economic summit conference of the Group of Seven nations begins today in Toronto. Heads of state from the United States, Japan, West Germany, France, Britain, Italy and Canada will meet, but most analysts are not expecting...
docs.lead_paragraph: LEAD: The annual economic summit conference of the Group of Seven nations begins today in Toronto. Heads of state from the United States, Japan, West Germany, France, Britain, Italy and Canada will meet, but most analysts are not expecting breakthroughs. Important items on the agenda include giving a greater role to gold in fixing exchange rates, phasing out agricultural subsidies and prompting the European countries to increase their rates of economic growth.

headline.main: The Forecast Is for All Talk, No Action
headline.kicker: BUSINESS FORUM: REAGAN'S FINAL SUMMIT CONFERENCE

docs.snippet: LEAD: After years of bitter wrangling, Japan and the United States agreed this morning on measures that would significantly expand Japan's market for American beef and oranges.

docs.snippet: LEAD: Former President Aparicio Mendez, who served for five years as the figurehead chief of state when Uruguay was ruled by the armed forces in the late 1970's and early 1980's, died Sunday after a long illness, officials said. He was 84 years old.
